ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course. It's both useful because of the importance of the material, and it's also a good opportunity to meet students in other subfields, since we otherwise tend to have little contact with each other.
General reading course in theory of religion.
Yes, it is very important to be familiar with this material.

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course for those who need to be familiar with theories related to the study of religion and who also need the space to think through how they might relate to one's own field and research.

An introduction to theory as it is employed in the field of religious studies (as opposed to literature).I would recommend it to someone who wants to know more about the rest of the field of religious studies or to someone who needs a similar requirement.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Gave me the opportunity to read useful theory

This course offers all of us in religious studies the opportunity to become familiar with theories of religion that we must know in order to engage with issues of religion across different fields of study and is also necessary for the religious studies job market.
